docs.lead_paragraph: As the sun sets over the land on Election Day, the American West could become the landscape of victory for the man who will be president in the next four years. For all the attention that the parties are paying to Sioux City, Iowa, or Dayton, Ohio, the election may well be decided in places like Lake Havasu City, Ariz., where the London Bridge was transplanted to the sands of the Mojave Desert, or here at Acoma, an Indian pueblo that claims to be the oldest continuously inhabited city in the nation.

headline.main: An Evolving Identity Helps to Leave Five States in Search of a President

docs.snippet: In the West, home to many independent-minded voters, five states with 36 electoral votes are within reach of either candidate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 2-year-old girl who was trapped with her slain mother inside a sport utility vehicle on a busy Queens street had been there for four and a half days before her rescue on Thursday, the police said yesterday. They also revealed that they were investigating the handling of a 911 call reporting a baby in a car that could have helped them find her a day earlier. The girl, who was severely dehydrated, remained in critical condition yesterday. Details of her ordeal emerged as the police announced the arrest of her mother's boyfriend, Leonardo Almonte, 32 in the killing.

headline.main: Girl Remained Trapped in Car After 911 Call

docs.snippet: Police say the 2-year-old girl who was trapped with her slain mother inside a vehicle on a busy Queens street had been there for four and a half days before her rescue.

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

docs.lead_paragraph: Another sharp drop in oil prices helped Wall Street overcome profit taking yesterday and extend its gains to a third consecutive session. Concern over China's decision to raise its benchmark interest rate for the first time in nine years put pressure on materials and energy stocks, as investors worried about slower demand from what is the world's fastest-growing economy. The move, however, also encouraged selling in oil.

headline.main: Sharp Drop in Oil Prices Helps Shares Rise a Third Day

docs.abstract: Sharp Drop in Oil Prices Helps

docs.lead_paragraph: The decomposing body of a homicide victim was found yesterday in her locked sport utility vehicle in Jamaica, Queens, and her 2-year-old daughter, in critical condition from dehydration, was found in the back seat after being strapped in for what may have been two days or longer, the authorities said. The woman, identified by friends as Cesarina Colon, 29, was found, beaten and shot, in the front passenger seat of her gray Toyota S.U.V., which was parked next to a self-storage center. The police said they received a call about 11:30 a.m. yesterday that a dead woman was in a vehicle parked on 95th Avenue just east of the Van Wyck Expressway, about two miles from Ms. Colon's home. The child, friends said, is Ms. Colon's daughter Catherine.

headline.main: Slain Woman And Ailing Girl Are Discovered In a Parked Car

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON; William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting for this article

docs.lead_paragraph: We remain optimistic that this year's divisive and unnecessary fight over granting same-sex couples the freedom to marry will inevitably be won in the courts and in the hearts of Americans. The fact that President Bush felt compelled to separate himself from his party platform's opposition to civil unions for same-sex couples is a sign of where the public really stands after a court decision opened the door for same-sex marriages in Massachusetts. Still, with measures banning same-sex marriage on the ballot in 11 states next Tuesday, those who favor giving gay partners the right to marry need to brace themselves for some painful setbacks. According to opinion polls and advocates on both sides of the issue, the bans are likely to win approval in at least 10 of the states, including deeply conservative ones like Georgia and Mississippi and more moderate states like Michigan and Ohio.
docs.abstract: Editorial says effort to ban same-sex marriage is this year's divisive and unnecessary fight, appearing on ballot in 11 states; says whatever election results are, matter is sure to be settled in courts; expects many ups and downs before essential unfairness of denying committed couples right to marry leads to change
docs.snippet: With measures banning same-sex marriage on the ballot in 11 states, those who favor giving gay partners the right to marry need to brace themselves for some setbacks.
